title: Dominant Industry Sector
description: In 2023, Libya's industry sector, including construction, contributed 77.34% to the GDP, showcasing its significant role in the economy.

title: High Oil Dependency
description: In 2021, oil rents accounted for 56.38% of Libya's GDP, indicating a heavy reliance on oil revenues.

title: Substantial Natural Resource Rents
description: In 2021, total natural resources rents made up 61.03% of Libya's GDP, reflecting the country's wealth in natural resources.

title: Robust Financial Services Export
description: In 2021, insurance and financial services constituted 67.03% of service exports, highlighting a strong financial sector.

title: Exceptional Bank Liquidity
description: In 2024, Libya's bank liquid reserves to bank assets ratio was 214.12%, indicating a highly liquid banking sector.

title: Ample Foreign Reserves
description: In 2021, Libya had total reserves equivalent to 36.81 months of imports, ensuring a strong buffer against external shocks.

title: Strong Commercial Service Exports
description: In 2021, insurance and financial services made up 67.60% of commercial service exports, underscoring the sector's importance.

title: Minimal Use of Alternative and Nuclear Energy
description: In 2020, Libya's alternative and nuclear energy usage was only 0.01% of its total energy consumption, indicating a heavy reliance on traditional energy sources.

title: Decline in Government Claims
description: In 2022, Libya experienced a significant decrease in claims on the central government, with a -23.65% growth rate in broad money terms.

title: Low Broad Money to Reserves Ratio
description: Libya's broad money to total reserves ratio was 0.28 in 2021, suggesting limited financial reserves relative to its money supply.

title: Negative Broad Money Growth
description: In 2021, Libya's broad money growth was -20.26%, indicating a contraction in the money supply.

title: Poor Trade and Transport Infrastructure
description: Libya scored 1.7 out of 5 on the logistics performance index for trade and transport infrastructure quality in 2022, highlighting significant infrastructure challenges.

title: Overall Low Logistics Performance
description: With an overall logistics performance index score of 1.9 in 2022, Libya faces challenges in trade efficiency and logistics.

title: Negative Gross Savings Rate
description: In 2020, Libya's adjusted gross savings were -14.16% of GNI, indicating a lack of savings and potential economic vulnerability.

title: High Net Savings Deficit
description: Libya's adjusted net savings, including particulate emission damage, was -$13.77 billion in 2020, reflecting significant economic challenges.

title: Net Savings Excluding Emission Damage
description: In 2020, Libya's adjusted net savings, excluding particulate emission damage, stood at -$13.47 billion, indicating financial strain.

title: Negative Product Tax Revenue
description: In 2023, Libya's taxes less subsidies on products were -9.85 billion LCU, suggesting a negative fiscal balance in this area.

title: Constant Product Tax Revenue Deficit
description: Libya's taxes less subsidies on products, in constant LCU, were -4.42 billion in 2023, highlighting fiscal challenges.

title: Low Rule of Law Confidence
description: In 2023, Libya's rule of law percentile rank lower bound was 0.94, indicating challenges in governance and legal frameworks.

title: Minimal Female Alcohol Consumption
description: In 2020, Libya's total alcohol consumption per capita for females was 0.002 liters, reflecting cultural or legal restrictions on alcohol use.
